short_summary: Purchase of Rectifiers, Inverters and Converters (or equivalent) for the RCMP.
description: The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. As a result, the integrity provisions are being applied in RCMP contracting activities as outlined in this solicitation.Canada will make available Notices of Proposed Procurement (NPP), bid solicitations and related documents for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at http://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders. Canada is not responsible and will not assume any liabilities whatsoever for the information found on websites of third parties. In the event an NPP, bid solicitation or related documentation would be amended, Canada will not be sending notifications. Canada will post all amendments, including significant enquiries received and their replies, using GETS. It is the sole responsibility of the Bidder to regularly consult GETS for the most up-to-date information. Canada will not be liable for any oversight on the Bidder's part nor for notification services offered by a third party.
duration_in_months: a complex tender for approximately Test period = (end date) - (start date)
full_summary:
**Rectifiers, Inverters and Converters (or Equivalent)**
**Reference:** PW-22-01016088
**Bid Solicitation:** 202103640
**Publication Date:** 2022-12-09
**Tender Closing Date:** 2022-12-23T13:00:00

**Notice:**
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is soliciting for the procurement of various rectifier, inverter, and converter systems. The solicitation is under the "Request for Proposal" (RFP) category.

**Requirements:**

* The successful bidder will be required to deliver four (4) Alpha Cordex 24V 400 Bulk Power rectifier shelf systems
* Two (2) Inverters 1500W, twelve (12) Inverters 300W
* Four (4) ICT Converters, six (6) Inverters Racks, and four (4) Converters Racks
* Twelve (12) Storage Batteries and four (4) DC Distribution Panel
* Four (4) Rack Mount Power Bars

** Tender Timeline:**

* All deliverables are to be received by March 31, 2023
* Proponents are to submit their proposals to the RCMP Procurement Officer by email

**Evaluation Criteria:**
The basis of selection will be the lowest price, compliant bidder. The evaluations and selections will be conducted in accordance with the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada.

**Canadians who want to become qualified Suppliers:**
Interested individuals may contact PSPC at steve.dumaresq@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca to inquire about becoming a qualified Supplier and obtaining additional information regarding this program.

**View the Solicitation:**
Please refer to the official Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website (http://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders) for the complete solicitation document and amendments. 

If an amendment is made or if new documentation is added, a notice will be issued and posted to the GETS website. You are responsible for checking it regularly for updates.
Only respond with renewed content written in nice markdown format. 

SEE BELOW FOR ATACHMENTS.
